resources.string: Prevents flight above %1$s outdoors and %2$s indoors when GPS is weak.
Your drone will stay about %1$s away from obstacles.
CAUTION: Increased risk of collision\nYour drone will stay about %1$s away from obstacles.
CAUTION: Your drone will slightly assist in avoiding obstacles, but primarily rely on the pilot to prevent collisions.
WARNING: No obstacle avoidance\nYour drone will not avoid obstacles.
Smoother flight performance for a more stabilized video.
Precise maneuvering for more exact flight control.
Track subjects, plan missions, and fly manually.
R Trigger commands physical zoom. Note: \'prod\' vehicles without \'allow-superzoom\' are forced to Disabled.
R trigger commands superzoom. Note: \'prod\' vehicles with \'allow-superzoom\' are forced to Enabled.
Your drone will stay at least %1$s above the ground while tracking a subject and returning.
Your drone can fly close to the ground while tracking a subject and returning. Fly with caution.
Prevents flight above 66 ft when GPS is weak.
Enable to customize your maximum allowed drone altitude. The Height Ceiling altitude can only be set above the drone\'s current altitude. Follow all local laws and regulations.
If below specified Return Height (above launch point), ascend before returning.
Always ascend by the specified Return Height above the current position before returning.
The drone will look at the return destination.
The drone will look away from the return destination.
Your drone will stay at least %1$s above the ground while tracking a subject and returning.
Height Ceiling sets the maximum allowed drone altitude. The Height Ceiling can only be set above the drone’s current altitude.
Obstacle avoidance is always active during autonomous flight.
Obstacle avoidance is always active during this skill.
Your drone will stay about %1$s away from obstacles.
CAUTION: Increased risk of collision\nYour drone will stay about %1$s away from obstacles.
CAUTION: Your drone will slightly assist in avoiding obstacles, but primarily rely on the pilot to prevent collisions.
WARNING: No obstacle avoidance\nYour drone will not avoid obstacles.
Your drone will land on your carrying case if visible in subject camera.
Your drone will not land on your carrying case if visible in subject camera.
Your drone will only fly using GPS, not avoid obstacles, and may require a calibration to launch.
Narrow band can provide additional wireless range; video quality may slightly degrade. When enabled, the drone will switch to narrow band whenever applicable.
Display map coordinates using latitude and longitude.
Display map coordinates using MGRS coordinates.
You must login to access your account\'s application.
If this persists please reboot the Controller.
Starting the Controller radio. This may take a few minutes.
Connect to your drone\'s WiFi network to continue.
Follow the link to download the correct app for your account.
Set the WiFi password for your drone.
Your drone is returning to where it was last following with a connection. Check the Map for the location.
Your drone is returning to where it was last following with a connection. Check the Map for the location.
Your drone is returning to the Home Point. Check the Map for the location.
Your drone is returning to the Launch Point. Check the Map for the location.
Your phone is not connected to the Beacon.
Your phone is not connected to the Controller. Check the cable.
You must update the Skydio app to fly with this version of the drone.
You must update your Skydio Enterprise Controller to connect to this drone.
Do not power-off your drone until the update completes.
This drone is already in use.
The Skydio app needs 1GB of free space on the phone to allow takeoff.
Turn on the Microphone permission so the app may run in the background.
The Skydio accessory may be linked to a different App on this device.
Beacon is trying to connect to your drone. Power on your drone.
Plug Beacon into your drone to pair with it.
Plug Controller into your drone to pair with it.
Controller is trying to connect to your drone. Power on your drone.
Update your drone for the latest flight experience.
Update your drone for the latest flight experience.
Warm up your drone\'s battery or move to a warmer area.
Ask to Return on Low Battery
The drone battery is too low to launch.
Press and hold the battery button for 15 seconds.
Please insert an SD card to record media.
SD card must be formatted to continue
Media may be unusable after flight.
SD Card must be UHS-Class 3 or greater.
This SD card does not have enough space to record a full flight.
Please insert an SD card to record logs.
SD Card must be formatted to continue.
SD Card must be formatted to continue.
SD Card must be UHS-Class 3 or greater.
This SD card does not have enough space to record a full flight.
Your phone requires at least 5% battery to launch.
You may not have enough battery to complete a full flight.
Your Beacon requires at least 20% battery to launch.
Your Controller requires at least 20% battery to launch.
At least 20% battery is recomended for flight.
Remove the battery and wait for the drone to cool off.
Autonomy requires more light to fly.
Your drone can not see well enough to fly safely.
Calibrate the drone to enable GPS Only.
Your drone does not have sufficient GPS quality for flight.
Flying without the Enterprise Controller is not supported.
Disable your phone\'s WiFi and connect to your Controller to launch.
Please connect Phone to Beacon for stronger connection strength.
Your drone is in an unauthorized runmode.
The drone will reboot to enter House Scan mode.
Flip your drone upside-down and back.
Please view and accept the updated Terms and Conditions.
View the Safety Guide before flight.
Make sure to extend all antennas before flight.
Remove the key and reboot the drone.
You can view the sensor package model and serial number in Information > “Drone Name”
An error occurred during the update process. Reboot the drone to try again.
Enable the service by turning on Location.
Enable the service by turning on Location. Go to Settings, Privacy, and enable Location Services.
Reboot drone or continue without thermal camera feed.
Low battery auto-land is disabled.\nThe warranty will not cover a low battery inflight power off.
Obstacle Avoidance: Close\nThe drone warranty will not cover damages from this flight.
Obstacle Avoidance: Minimal\nThe drone warranty will not cover damages from this flight.
Obstacle Avoidance: Disabled\nThe drone warranty will not cover damages from this flight.
The Height Floor is enabled. Tracking performance may be reduced.
Your drone will hover in place until low battery, then land straight down. Check the Map for the location.
After 60 seconds: drone flies to Rally Point. After 30 more seconds: drone flies to Launch Point. If also low battery, drone will fly to Rally Point after 10 seconds.
At low battery level the drone will return to the Rally Point (if set manually). After 60 seconds, the drone will return to the Launch Point. At critical battery level the drone will auto-land.
This will remove any custom button mapping and revert all controls settings to their default.
Button Press\nSwitch between the thermal and color camera
Button Press\nChanges map between PiP and full screen
Button Press\nToggles the close obstacle avoidance mode
Button Press\nToggles the minimal obstacle avoidance mode
Adjusts the angle of the sensor
Button Press\nDrone stops at obstacles and moves slowly near structures
Your controlling device is gathering data from your drone, please wait until finished.
Connect your controlling device to the Internet to sync data files to Skydio Cloud.
Your controlling device is uploading data to the Cloud, please wait until finished.
In order to fly you need to complete an additional registration step.\nThis is usually handled through a government registration app
You are about to enable lights on your drone.
Button Press\nChange between GPS and vision-based flight

After 60 seconds: drone flies to Rally Point. After 30 more seconds: drone flies to Launch Point. If also low battery, drone will fly to Rally Point after 10 seconds.\n\nAt low battery level the drone will return to the Rally Point (if set manually). After 60 seconds, the drone will return to the Launch Point. At critical battery level the drone will auto-land.
Drone stops at obstacles and moves slowly near structures.
Selecting DFS will require a 1 minute disconnection for a regulatory scan.
When the drone lands, you can automatically or manually end the flight.
The drone will begin to land in place while in Attitude mode after 5 seconds of no stick input.
Connect to base station to use RTK
Allows for top flight speed by disabling NightSense during boost, when GPS is available.
NightSense will activate and remain on while flying in degraded GPS, to prevent going into Attitude mode.
Auto-On When Entering Low Light Flight Mode
NightSense lights turn on whenever entering Low Light Flight Mode to maintain obstacle avoidance.
Low Light Flight Mode enables flight in dim environments, including when only GPS is available.
An error occurred during the update process. Reboot the drone to try again.
Button Press\nTurn attachment lights on and off when flying in low-light mode
Button Hold\nForces Attitude Mode flight without position hold or obstacle avoidance when button is held down.
Allows for the controller\'s joystick and roller inputs to be registered.
Exit Flight Deck will return you to the gate screen.
Enter Perch will allow you to enter perch state after landing.
Obstacle avoidance disabled when attitude mode is enabled
If attitude mode and vehicle GPS are off, vehicle will use VIO only.
Standard mode using the Skydio vision system with GPS.
An adaptive scan for autonomous inspection.
Conduct flights from a moving craft using GPS.
Avoid obstacles at night using the vision system and GPS.
The drone will not use the vision system or GPS to hold position.
View the full size of the image sensor onscreen in 4:3 format.
Unable to connect. Check RTK settings.
Connection timed out. Check RTK settings.
Time / date of media and logs may be inaccurate. Reboot the vehicle or connect it to the Internet (online drones only) to resolve. Continue with flight if timestamps are non-essential.
To set auto bitrate, set this to any value over 6000kbps
Button Press\nCycles through full screen and split screen layouts
Button Press\nCycles through full screen, split screen, and grid layouts
Button Press\nCycle between thermal color palettes
Button Press\nCycles between the color camera and map view
Button Press\nCycles between the color camera, thermal, and map view
Show the 2ghz option in the radio picker menu.
Record screen on every flight and show in OS gallery.
Default enhanced wifi provides better range and video quality in congested environment. When disabled, the drone and controller will switch to normal wifi mode.
Optional setting to change the controlling radio from controller radio to external radio accessory kit.
Your drone will fly using GPS only, will not avoid obstacles, and may require a calibration to launch.
You will be asked to select a low battery behavior when your drone only has enough battery to return and land.
Your drone will automatically return using your return settings.
Automatically cycle to the next defined preset when wireless quality degrades
Selecting another frequency will cause the controller to momentarily lose connection to the drone.
Selecting fixed fps will disable adaptive framerate mechanism.
Switch to narrow band on flight (testing only)
There is a high risk of crashing in Attitude mode.
Disables obstacle avoidance, increasing risk of a crash.
Allows for manual and automatic deployment in flight. the parachute will arm right after launch and can be deployed at any height.
Parachute will be temporarily disarmed while launching, landing and perching.
When in Boost, your drone will be able to descend even faster, moving laterally in order to maintain stability.
Button press\nLooks at horizon and camera zooms out
Button Press\nTurn the RGB lights on and off
Button Press\nTurn the strobe lights on and off
TBTT-Aligned scheduling scheme provides strict control over downlink and uplink transmissions which legacy 802.11 lacks.
Start Streaming Audio from Vehicle to Controller
Disable Vehicle GPS by toggling off
Displays compositional guides over the camera feeds. Will not show on captured photos and video.
